solution_line_template: There are {num_rows} x {squares_per_row} = <<{num_rows}*{squares_per_row}={total_squares}>>{total_squares} squares in a grid.
There are {blue_rows_top} + {blue_rows_bottom} = <<{blue_rows_top}+{blue_rows_bottom}={total_blue_rows}>>{total_blue_rows} rows that are all blue.
Thus, a total of {total_blue_rows} x {squares_per_row} = <<{total_blue_rows}*{squares_per_row}={blue_squares}>>{blue_squares} squares are colored blue.
{red_squares} + {blue_squares} = <<{red_squares}+{blue_squares}={red_or_blue_squares}>>{red_or_blue_squares} squares are color red or blue.
